# 2021 President's Cup – Men's singles__disambig_1

Max Purcell
| runner   =  Jay Clarke
| score    = 3–6, 6–4, 7–6(8–6)
| edition  =
| before_name  = President's Cup (tennis) – Men's singles
| before_year  = 2019
| main_name  = President's Cup (tennis)  President's Cup
| after_year  = 2021
| after_name  = President's Cup II – Singles
}}
Evgeny Donskoy was the defending champion but chose not to defend his title.
Max Purcell won the title after defeating Jay Clarke 3–6, 6–4, 7–6(8–6) in the final.
Seeds
Roman Safiullin (quarterfinals)
#  Denis Istomin (first round)
#  Jay Clarke (final)
#  Max Purcell (champion)
#  Borna Gojo (semifinals)
#  Sergiy Stakhovsky (second round)
#  Peter Polansky (semifinals)
#  Hugo Grenier (first round)
}}
